intro: Lannea cufodontii, commonly known as the African wild pear, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its thick, corky bark and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to edible, orange-colored fruits. Lannea cufodontii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fruit is an important food source for both wildlife and humans in its native habitat.
